title: Shopify Stock Tumbles After Forecasting Slower Revenue Growth
sub_head: E-commerce services provider to spend on building out its order fulfillment network for merchants
body:
Shares of Shopify Inc. fell 17% Wednesday, after the company told investors that the forces that made the e-commerce software provider one of the biggest winners of the Covid-19 pandemic are starting to slow.
Lockdowns pushed millions of small businesses to open online stores, as retail sales rapidly shifted away from physical stores. U.S. retail e-commerce sales grew 32% in 2020 from the prior year, according to the U.S. Commerce Department.
